message: Do I just need to specify the Postgres configuration(http://goo.gl/XDjSI) and then make a remote connection with pgadmin?
@citadelgrad No, you can't connect from outside for security reasons; instead, I'd upload a SQL dump and then use "epio run_command psql -f sql_dump.sql"
@andrewgodwin Thanks, I'll give that a try.
@andrewgodwin I was getting an error message using the -f param. But I was able to access psql with "epio run_command psql -a <app_name>"
I ended up using the "epio django loadata fixture/fixture.json -a <app_name>" to upload my data.
@citadelgrad Alright. If you can bung us the error at some point we'll look into it
hi, How do i upload my db backup file to the server?
is there a way to selectively upload 1 file?  is there some filter that prevents upload of .sql file to server?
No, just upload it as part of your app for now
otherwise you can run 'epio run_command -a pipiki bash' and 'cd ../data/' and wget your backup from somewhere safe.
it would be nice to make a small script that does something like this, or if you could refer to a local file when running psql -f filename.sql for example
@peppelorum You should be able to pipe a file to psql using something like "epio run_command psql < local_file.sql", but it's not particularly efficient
